meanings.definition: Relating to, situated at, or forming the base.
meanings.sent1: The basilary layer provided a sturdy foundation for the structure.
meanings.sent2: The basilary part of the building was essential for its stability.
meanings.sent3: The basilary support was so strong, it held up the entire structure effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her unwavering confidence acted as the basilary pillar of the team.
meanings.sent5: The basilary roots of the tree spread deep into the ground, anchoring it firmly.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the basilica of ancient Rome.
meanings.sent1: The basilary architecture of the basilica showcased intricate designs.
meanings.sent2: Visiting the basilary basilica was a highlight of the trip to Rome.
meanings.sent3: The basilary columns of the basilica stood tall and majestic.
meanings.sent4: Her dress resembled the basilary robes worn by ancient Romans.
meanings.sent5: The basilary artwork in the basilica depicted scenes from Roman history.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the base of the skull.
meanings.sent1: The basilary bone at the base of the skull provided protection.
meanings.sent2: The doctor examined the basilary area carefully for any injuries.
meanings.sent3: The basilary region of the skull was surprisingly sensitive to touch.
meanings.sent4: Her headache seemed to originate from the basilary part of her head.
meanings.sent5: The basilary nerves connected the brain to the rest of the body.
